Hi, I'm Wiem Ben Rim

Hi there. My name is Wiem (wiː æm / ウイエム).

I'm a PhD student at the Foundational AI Center for Doctoral Training at University College London. I am a part of both the UCLNLP and Web Intelligence groups under the supervision of Emine Yilmaz and Pontus Stenetorp. I am also an ELLIS scholar.

I was previously a research scientist at NEC Laboratories Europe, based in Heidelberg, Germany. I completed my Master’s of Engineering in Artificial Intelligence at Tokyo Institute of Technology (東京工業大学） where I was member of Okazaki lab（岡崎研究室), a Natural Language Processing lab. Before that, I was also a member of Tsuruoka lab in the University of Tokyo（東京大学) , as a research student.

I am currently conducting research in Explainable and Human-centered AI in the context of NLP. I have a background of work and internships at startups as an mobile developer, so I am naturally interested in applied Machine Learning as well (and a fan of clean, well-thought-out code).

I obtained my bachelor’s of Science in Computer Science from the American University of Beirut, in Lebanon where I minored in applied mathematics and philosophy. I am originally from a beautiful coastal city in Tunisia, North Africa.

I was lucky to be the recipient of various scholarships and grants that covered my higher education journey, and therefore I am always happy to share my experience and help qualified and motivated people find better opportunities, if I can.

Updates

Starting PhD! New

I have accepted an offer for PhD at University College London. Looking forward to this new chapter in the UK!

I'll be attending CHI2023 in Hamburg, Germany. Come say hi!

Workshop paper at AAAI2023

Our paper was accepted at The Representation Learning for Responsible Human-Centric AI workshop

Community Engagement

I have a youtube channel where I post videos to help young people from developing countries pursue opportunities abroad, such as applying for scholarships, applying for jobs and preparing for a career in research.

Currently, a lot of the videos are to help students apply for the MEXT research scholarship to complete graduate studies in Japan.

I also manage a discord server that you can find here.

Youtube Channel

Recent tweets

Can't be in the reseearch sphere without tweets to back you up. Here you can find some tweets from conferences and about the research I am working on!

Super excited about our work KGxBoard that allows researchers to upload KGE model outputs to analyze in a fine-grained manner what the model learned and what are its weaknesses. It’s a demo paper at EMNLP, details below! https://t.co/9La4unFa8j

— Wiem (@PhaelIshall) December 9, 2022

Checkout our poster "A Human-Centric Assessment Framework for AI" at #BlackboxNLP at #emnlp2022 tomorrow b/w 11:00-12:30! We tackle the question: How can we assess (X)AI systems in a human-centric manner? For a short 2m talk, see the video: https://t.co/ozpBRALkAO Details in🧵1/ pic.twitter.com/VAjsa3GWp1

— Kiril Gashteovski (@kgashteo) December 7, 2022
